feed.title: KITAB Project
feed.subtitle: Knowledge, Information Technology, and the Arabic Book - Studying the formation and development of the written Arabic tradition with digital methods

author.name: {"name"=>"", "avatar"=>"/images/kitab/logo-small-2.png", "bio"=>"Standing for, Knowledge, Information Technology, and the Arabic Book, KITAB is a project that provides a digital tool-box and a forum for discussions about Arabic texts. We wish to empower users to explore Arabic texts in completely new ways and to expand the frontiers of knowledge about one of the world’s largest and most complex textual traditions. We are leading with a tool that detects how authors copied previous works. Arabic authors frequently made use of past works, cutting them into pieces and reconstituting them to address their own outlooks and concerns. Now you can discover relationships between these texts and also the profoundly intertextual circulatory systems in which they sit.", "location"=>"AKU, London, UK", "email"=>"sarah.savant@aku.edu", "uri"=>nil, "flickr"=>nil, "facebook"=>"", "github"=>"SarahKITAB", "google_plus"=>nil, "instagram"=>nil, "linkedin"=>nil, "pinterest"=>nil, "soundcloud"=>nil, "stackoverflow"=>nil, "steam"=>nil, "tumblr"=>nil, "twitter"=>""}
